description.narrative: Employment generation: - the project will create direct and indirect employment; - the project will provide skilled and unskilled jobs during the construction phase; - the project will create temporary jobs during construction; - the project is expected to add permanent jobs at the NCCL facilities; and - the project will create a large number of indirect jobs in the transportation and delivery sectors. Increased local supply chain and consumption of local goods and services: - the project will create new business opportunities in the local economy due to increased demand for the supply of raw materials and delivery services. In particular, it will benefit those small and medium enterprises engaged in transporting the company''s raw materials and products in their own trucks and providing maintenance and general services to the company; and - the communities close to the plant will benefit as they will provide local services and supplies to the plant and its employees. Other benefits to local communities: - the local communities will benefit from the company''s corporate social responsibility initiatives including the development of community infrastructure and the establishment of a scholarship fund. Environmental and social performance: - by complying with IFC''s performance standards and the World Bank Group''s environmental, health and safety (EHS) standards, the company will achieve higher environmental and social standards, which should increase its reputation, reduce the risk of adverse impacts on local communities, and increase the credibility of the private sector with respect to corporate social responsibility. Private sector development: - the success of the project will send a positive signal to other investors considering investments in Kenya; and - the project is expected to set environmental and social standards that can be replicated by other cement producers.

The project involves first the expansion of the Athi River grinding plant of National Cement Company Limited (NCCL), in order to have an installed nominal cement grinding capacity of 1.7 million tons per annum (Mtpa) of Portland cement. It is located at Athi River, c.40 km south of Nairobi, Kenyas capital. Secondly, a new clinker production line will be built at Merueshi, c.160 km south of Nairobi, near the Nairobi-Mombasa highway. The nominal capacity of the kiln is expected to be 3,300 tons per day (tpd) or 1.1Mtpa, assuming a maximum 330 days of annual operation.
